column4: Hmm ok now md5sum was correct then i burned it on dvd and now it gives me error failed to read sector 0x5xxxx (some numbers) on cd0
Is that problem with dvd now?
Did you burn as an image?
yes i used Img-burn and after thath when i press enter is display same error as before
Make sure it is burned at the slowest speed, I assume you have checked the md5 on this download.
yes it was burned at slowest speed and md5 was checked and it was matching
What is the computer model again, some need a f6 prompt of choice to get a boot?

I can't find any references to linux or ubuntu with this computer, it seems to be a model that is specific for distribution outside of english speaking countries IE europe or the west, as I find most refrences in other languages, but this has to be a standard release by lenove I would think.
i will try to burn one more dvd to see if it works or no :D
Good idea if you have a usb flash I would try that as well.
Just the loaders there are a handful to choose from unetbootin is commonly suggested.
i found what is wrong :D
I forget the issue.
yesterday problems with grub because its not showing me Windows 7
cool what was it, besides the GPT?
i messed it with install, i should do it difrren since i have one thing called UEFI, and i need to preform diffrent installation.
I new it had to be a specific type install, but not having experience here I was hesitant to advise, I don't want to brick anothers setup.
can you recommend me how should i now partiton my 1 tb disc? For both windows and ubuntu? I am going to do fresh install now.

Personally since I only use my W7 setup for just a few things I put it in a small partition, big enough though, and ubuntu the same, and have a shared NTFS for both the read and write to to exchange media....etc.
I keep my OS in small partition, but big enough so I can clone them for any future problems.
and what about others for swap etc?

for example on a 160 gig HD I have 4 OS the W7 in a 40 gig and the others since they are linux a bit smaller and a NTFS to share with the W& and linux install 4 partitions, the ntfs for windows and share are primary partitions the other 3 are logicals in a extended.
I use a swap in the OS that adjust with needs, I don't hibernate so this works for me a normal swap would be equal to the ram at the least.
